name: HTML
content:
# HTML

The HTML element is the top-level element of an HTML document. This HTML tag `<html>` is the container for all other HTML elements (except for the `<!DOCTYPE>` tag).

examples.description: Using the `<html>` tag to write a simple HTML document.
examples.code:
``` Title of the document

HTML Tag

The HTML element is the top-level element of an HTML document.

```

short_description:
HTML
The HTML element is the top-level element of an HTML document. This HTML tag <html> is the container for all other HTML elements (except for the <!DOCTYPE> tag).
tips:
* The `<html>` tag is placed right under the <!DOCTYPE> tag.
* The `<html>` tag requires a starting and end tag.
* The `<html>` contains every other tab that makes up the webpage. Thatâ€™s why the closing tag `</html>` is all the way at the bottom.
